intro: Spergularia diandra maura, commonly known as the sand spurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments. Spergularia diandra maura is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
